Love this game, even tho, camping, tunneling and toxic behaviour exists. Many differeny killers to face and to play as, and a good variety in surviviors too, with many different outfits. I like that there are many different maps, but wished they made new ones quicker. New chapter  with new killer and survivor comming every 3rd month. All i all, a fun game, even tho it can be boring too.

Do you like playing a game for 2k+ hours and still not having unlocked half the stuff? Do you like getting more points then your entire team combined, and still be called useless? Grind battle pass for 300 hours? Being called a barrel of toxic waste? Clearly play better then the killer and still die because NOED is somehow still a perk in 2021? Then this game, is for you my guy. But in all fairness, despite how janky this game and some of the community is, it still makes me raise my eyebrow once in a while.

Imagine this, you are looking through the steam store for new games and you find dbd. All the reviews say it's an unbalanced mess full of bugs and a community more toxic than the Chernobyl explosion, but you ignore all of them and buy it anyway.
After 500h of getting t-bagged by toxic Neas with 5000h and getting facecamp by Bubbas, you feel like you want to quit, but you remember Jane's ticc booty and keep on playing.
0/10 for gameplay
10/10 for Jane

An sich ist es ein gutes Spiel, aber ich habe keine Ahnung was sie mit dem Spiel in den letzten Monaten gemacht haben. Als Survivor hat man kaum noch Spa√ü, vorallem in den High Ranks, da die Killer alle nur noch campen oder Killer spielen gegen die man nicht viel machen kann. Alleine der neue Killer Trickster ist so op, dass jedesmal wenn man gegen ihn spielt mindestens eine Person leaved. Daran sollte man sehen, dass das Spiel einen gewaltigen Fehler hat. Dead by Daylight fix your game!

This game is really fun but its more fun when you have friends to play it with i've played this game on ps4 then switched to pc and still like the game and there always coming out with new skins and killers so i would really recommend getting it.

After playing quite a bit of DBDL, I found the game to overall be enjoyable, although flawed. There are not many asymetric PVP type games, and DBDL seems to balance the fairness, despite the difficulties that come with balancing a game like this. Getting into the game is rather hard, as a lot of the perks and characters take a while to learn, but once you get the hang of it it's not too hard. There is quite a heavy paywall though, as many of the "good" perks and characters (mostly killers) require you to not only pay around 5.00 USD for one character, but also grind that character to high level just to get the CHANCE of unlocking their special perks on other killers. This system is annoying and painful, and I feel is one of the main downsides. Otherwise, the game is flavorful and fun, matchmaking usually doesn't take too long, and it's a good change of pace from traditional multiplayer games. Overall, Fun, with its flaws.

This game is a ton of fun. The devs suck, however. You might end up getting your account suspended at least once in your playing experience. I've been suspended twice since playing and still don't know why they did that to me either time.

I hate this game.

10/10 would recommend.

perfect game to make yourself either feel better or feel worse. When you win, theres a sense of accomplishment, or when the killer is an "Afk killer" those are pog. However, when the killer is a face camping clown because they are not suited to be killer, eh. Theres a good variety of characters with many skills, and the adrenaline rush sometimes can be intense. Theres also an option to play with just your friends in a custom match, that's fun but can ruin friendships ( Jizzel >:[ )  when your friends are a little toxic. You can get over all of that though. Some downsides are that they seem to have made killers faster and buffed some of them, which sucks a** and has made surviving against certain killers impossible. Also, if you disconnect from sh***y wifi, you lose all the stuff you brought into the game just like you would if you willingly disconnect. Wait times are terrible to get into lobbies unless you wait until like 5 AM EST, then it's pretty quick. It also takes a while to gain enough iridescent shards in order to get a new character, but if you like it and play a lot its not that big of a deal because you can be distracted with the Tomes/Rift. All in all, I'd recommend it. 

But if you're thinking of getting acrylic nails.... be aware it makes things A LOT more difficult.
